sections.subtitle: Managing expenses that don't fit neat monthly categories

sections.title: What You'll Learn
items: Creating sinking funds for predictable irregular costs

Adjusting your budget for life changes

sections.title: Common Irregular Expenses
sections.content: Irregular expenses include insurance premiums, property taxes, holiday gifts, vacations, car registration, medical deductibles, and home maintenance. These can cause cash flow problems if not planned for in advance.

points.title: Annual Expenses
points.description: Insurance, property taxes, subscriptions, memberships - occur once per year.

points.title: Semi-Annual Expenses
points.description: Car insurance, dentist visits, some utility bills - occur twice per year.

points.title: Quarterly Expenses
points.description: Some insurance payments, estimated taxes - occur four times per year.

sections.title: The Sinking Fund Solution
sections.content: For each irregular expense, divide the total cost by the number of months until it's due. Save that amount monthly in a separate account to avoid cash flow surprises.

sections.title: Creating Your Irregular Expense Plan
sections.content: List all irregular expenses and their typical costs. Calculate how much to save monthly for each. Set up separate savings accounts or use budgeting app categories to track progress toward these goals.

sections.title: Plan for Irregular Expenses
steps: List all irregular expenses and their approximate annual costs
Calculate monthly savings needed for each irregular expense
Set up sinking fund accounts or categories in your budget
Review and adjust your sinking fund amounts quarterly

sections.title: Build in Flexibility
sections.content: Life circumstances change, so build some flexibility into your sinking fund calculations. Review and adjust your savings amounts as needed.
